What is the importance of the Verus mainnet protocol update, and what happens if I don't upgrade?

This update is mandatory to remain on the Verus mainnet. If you don't upgrade, you may need to resynchronize the blockchain if you are running in native mode. The Verus mainnet protocol will hardfork at block 800200, and this update is necessary to ensure a smooth transition.

Avast and Kaspersky may flag the software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP". These are warnings that you are installing mining software, which may be installed by a third party to exploit your PC.
To find out more about the false positives, review the following resources:
https://blog.malwarebytes.com/detections/pup-optional-bitcoinminer/
https://www.kaspersky.com/blog/not-a-virus/18015/
# Notable Changes
* Enable optional VRSC or VRSCTEST chains as parent of an ID. For example, bob@ is equivalent to `bob.vrsc@` or, on testnet, `bob.vrsctest@`
* Update stratum protocol for mining to include solution information for miner, which enables smooth autoswitch and prepares for PBaaS merge mining
* Minor issues, including listidentities issue on Mac and compatibility with pool mining, even on block numbers under 16 to prepare for PBaaSThis release includes activation support for VerusID, and relative adjustment to the CPU and FPGA-equalizing VerusHash 2.1 Algorithm**AT BLOCK 800200, THE VERUS MAINNET PROTOCOL WILL HARDFORK, AND THIS UPDATE IS MANDATORY TO REMAIN ON THE VERUS MAINNET. MAKE SURE TO UPGRADE BY DECEMBER 15TH, OR YOU MAY NEED TO RESYNCHRONIZE THE BLOCKCHAIN IF YOU ARE RUNNING IN NATIVE MODE**# Verus ID
